amendment.description: Amendment makes it illegal to sell a traffic signal preemption transmitter to an unauthorized person.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 7 printed in House Report 109-15 to prohibit the sale or use of a traffic signal preemption transmitter (device that changes or alters a traffic signal's phase time or sequence) by a non-government approved user. Violators would be subject to a fine of up to $10,000 or one year imprisonment.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Rogers (MI) amendment Agreed to by voice vote.
